interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Good Girls Revolt
Review Date: 2016/12/31
Categories: Drama
Product Description: ['In 1969, while a cultural revolution swept through the free world, there was still one place that refused to change with the times: newsrooms. Good Girls Revolt follows a group of young female researchers at "News of the Week," who ask to be treated fairly. Their revolutionary request sparks convulsive changes and upends marriages, careers, sex lives, love lives, and friendships.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Français', 'Italiano', '日本語'], 'Directors': ['Scott Winant', 'Dan Attias', 'Gloria Muzio', 'Minkie Spiro', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Roxann Dawson'], 'Producers': ['Dana Calvo', 'Darlene Hunt', 'Lynda Obst', 'Jeff Okin', 'Scott Winant', 'Don Kurt'], 'Starring': ['Genevieve Angelson', 'Anna Camp', 'Erin Darke']}
Review Text: Wow! What a terrific story. I learned so much about the period and times.  It also made me become aware why I, as a female for the college newspaper, never got a by-line. I needed these ladies to wake up my eyes to the horrid discrimination between genders. I knew about pay, but did not know how women did the work and the men got the glory. Please, please watch this.  Though it is a fictional in dialogue, the story behind it is part of our history and how women were not looked at as having intelligence in the field.  What a disgrace. Yes, yes, watch this!
Review Title: It's about time to recognize the issue!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

I am late in watching this show. Now, I can't wait to watch the next episode. I love the acting, the scenery the costumes and the in-depth story line. It is a mastery piece of work!
Mastery
Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa Extended Version
Comedy, Feel-good, Outrageous, Fun
['Johnny Knoxville reprises his Jackass role as 86-year-old Irving Zisman in the story of a crotchety old man unexpectedly saddled with the care of his 8-year-old grandson Billy (Jackson Nicoll). Extended Version']
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeff Tremaine'], 'Producers': ['Johnny Knoxville', 'Spike Jonze', 'Jeff Tremaine', 'Derek Freda', 'Trip Taylor'], 'Starring': ['Johnny Knoxville']}
I would give it a minus 5 if there was a star for that. This is meant for the twenty something guy crowd. It was disgusting and embarrassing. The reviews said it was about a boy and his grandfather.  I never even got that far, it was so horrid.  I am too embarrassed to say how the movie even begins. My husband stared at me in disbelief. It is definitely not a family movie.  I guess I should have turned it off as soon as I saw "Jackass Presents..." I am in the dark, but not anymore.  Leave this for the guys and their immature minds.
It was disgusting and embarrassing

The Age Of Adaline
Fantasy, Drama, Beautiful, Gentle
['Blake Lively and Harrison Ford star in this stirring romantic drama about a 29-year-old woman who has stopped aging - and the timeless power of love.']
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lee Toland Krieger'], 'Producers': ['Sidney Kimmel', 'Tom Rosenberg', 'Gary Lucchesi'], 'Starring': ['Blake Lively', 'Michiel Huisman']}
This is the best movie we have seen a a long, long time. It was beautifully done. There was so much emotion in it, shared through the screen, giving us the same sorrows, laughter, tears and joy. We are still talking about it, days later!
Long, long time
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Zemeckis'], 'Producers': ['Steve Starkey', 'Robert Zemeckis', 'Gary Goetzman', 'William Teitler'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Michael Jeter', 'Nona Gaye'], 'Studio': ['WARNER HOME VIDEO']}
As a Christmas Eve tradition, we watch The Polar Express. Though our family has watched it yearly  since it first came out, we never tire of it, all of our emotions as if we were watching it for the first time. It is an excellent movie. Tom Hanks is extraordinary as the conductor, and the children are marvelous in their parts. The artistry and creativity of this film is magnificent. Place it in your video library, beside "It's A Wonderful Life" and "Miracle on 34th Street," movies that will please you and future viewers in all of the years to come.
A Tradition

profile:
User Summary:

The user exhibits a sophisticated preference for high-quality entertainment driven by emotionally resonant narratives and strong character development. Their recent interaction reveals a particular enthusiasm for dramas that explore significant social themes, reflecting their appreciation for content that blends historical context with meaningful storytelling. This demonstrates their openness to diverse genres while maintaining a standard for excellence, specifically in narratives that address critical issues such as gender equality.

While exploring engaging and thought-provoking series, the user remains committed to family-friendly content that prioritizes uplifting themes and meaningful connections. They continue to seek productions that steer clear of excessive vulgarity or intimate scenes, emphasizing their goal of fostering joy and inclusivity in their media consumption.

The user's dedication to well-crafted narratives, both classic and contemporary, underscores their desire for entertainment that not only captivates but also enriches personal connections and fosters reflection. Their preference for quality performances and emotional depth reinforces their pursuit of productions that inspire positivity. This thoughtful approach to media consumption underscores their commitment to rich, engaging storytelling that uplifts both themselves and those around them, demonstrating a balance between enjoyment and moral integrity in their viewing choices. Overall, the user exemplifies a discerning taste for narratives that resonate on multiple levels, combining entertainment with social awareness and emotional impact.
